byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and MOSI SECRET

abstract: Eleven people are charged in enormous fraud scheme in which hundreds of Long Island Rail Road workers falsely claimed to have disabling injuries, with some of them collecting tens of thousands of dollars in annual pensions; law enforcement officials say many employees who claim to be too disabled to stand, sit or walk spend time playing golf and tennis.
snippet: Some railroad workers who were collecting more than $100,000 in government payments and claimed to be in severe pain when moving regularly played tennis and golf, law enforcement officials said.
lead_paragraph: Some railroad workers who were collecting more than $100,000 in government payments and claimed to be in severe pain when moving regularly played tennis and golf, law enforcement officials said.

headline.main: 11 Charged in L.I.R.R. Disability Fraud Plot
headline.print_headline: Charges for 11 in Disability Fraud Plot at L.I.R.R.
